incidents.name: Issue Accessing WhatsApp Sender Configuration

incident_updates.body: Access issues to the WhatsApp sender configuration page in the Twilio Console have been resolved, and the service is operating normally at this time.

We have identified the issue and are actively working on the fix where customers are unable to access the WhatsApp sender configuration page in the Twilio Console. Affected users may encounter an error message stating, "Something went wrong. An internal server error has occurred. We are unable to handle this request at the moment. Try again later."

We will provide updates in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue where some customers are unable to access the WhatsApp sender configuration page in the Twilio Console. Affected users may encounter an error message stating, "Something went wrong. An internal server error has occurred. We are unable to handle this request at the moment. Try again later."

Our engineering teams has been engaged and are actively investigating. We will provide updates in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue where some customers are unable to access the WhatsApp sender configuration page in the Twilio Console. Affected users may encounter an error message stating, "Something went wrong. An internal server error has occurred. We are unable to handle this request at the moment. Try again later."

Our engineering teams has been engaged and are actively investigating. We will provide updates in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Programmable Messaging APIs Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Messaging APIs was degraded for 2 minutes between 09:59 and 10:01 Pacific Time  and then again between 10:27 and 10:29 Pacific Time on 02/03/2026. During this period of time customers may have experienced high error rate connecting to Twilio's messaging APIs. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Twilio Messaging in IE1 Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Messaging in IE1 was degraded for 5 minutes between 3 February 2026 09:35 AM UTC and 09:40 AM UTC. During this period of time customers may have experienced delays in message status updates for certain messages in the IE1 region. The issue has now been resolved.

We are currently investigating a decrease in delivery receipts (DLRs) for RCS (Rich Communication Services) messages. Our engineering teams are actively working to identify the root cause and restore normal delivery performance as quickly as possible. Customers may experience Verify unable to perform any fallback to SMS.

We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: High Error Rates for Conversations and Programmable Video in IE1

incident_updates.body: "404" errors from Cloudfront for Conversation API calls or increased error rates when trying to connect to Video Rooms has been resolved and programmable video is operating normally at this time.

Due to a third party provider, Conversations and Programmable Video were degraded between 7:53 AM to 9:28 AM Pacific Time on 01/28/2026. During this period, customers may have experienced "404" errors from Cloudfront for Conversation API calls or increased error rates when trying to connect to Video Rooms. The issue has been mitigated, but we are continuing to monitor. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to a third party provider, Conversations and Programmable Video were degraded between 7:53 AM to 9:28 AM Pacific Time on 01/28/2026. During this period, customers may have experienced "404" errors from Cloudfront for Conversation API calls or increased error rates when trying to connect to Video Rooms. The issue has been mitigated, but we are continuing to monitor. We'll provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Sync Platform and Conversations Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Sync Platform and Conversations were degraded between 7:53 AM to 9:22 AM Pacific Time on 01/28/2026. During this period of time customers may have experienced delay in webhooks related to sync object mutations (add, delete, edit) and 404 from Cloudfront in IE1 for any public api calls. The issue has now been resolved.
